007package renderer.scene.util;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012import java.util.List;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.awt.Color;
015import java.util.Random;
016
017/**
018   This is a library of static methods that
019   add color shading to a {@link Model}.
020*/
021public class ModelShading
022{
023   /**
024      Set each front face {@link Color} in the {@link Model}'s color list
025      to the same {@link Color}.
026
027      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
028      @param c      {@link Color} for all of this model's {@link Vertex} objects
029   */
030   public static void setColor(final Model model, final Color c)
031   {
032      if (model.colorList.isEmpty())
033      {
034         for (int i = 0; i < model.vertexList.size(); ++i)
035         {
036            model.colorList.add(c);
037         }
038      }
039      else
040      {
041         for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
042         {
043            for (final int i : p.cIndexList)
044            {
045               model.colorList.set(i, c);
046            }
047         }
048      }
049      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
050      {
051         setColor(m, c); // recursion
052      }
053   }
054
055
056   /**
057      Set each front face {@link Color} in the {@link Model}'s color list
058      to the same random {@link Color}.
059
060      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
061   */
062   public static void setRandomColor(final Model model)
063   {
064      setColor(model, randomColor());
065   }
066
067
068   /**
069      Set each front face {@link Color} in the {@link Model}'s color list
070      to a different random {@link Color}.
071
072      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
073   */
074   public static void setRandomColors(final Model model)
075   {
076      if (model.colorList.isEmpty())
077      {
078         for (int i = 0; i < model.vertexList.size(); ++i)
079         {
080            model.colorList.add(randomColor());
081         }
082      }
083      else
084      {
085         for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
086         {
087            for (final int i : p.cIndexList)
088            {
089               model.colorList.set(i, randomColor());
090            }
091         }
092      }
093      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
094      {
095         setRandomColors(m); // recursion
096      }
097   }
098
099
100   /**
101      Set each front face {@link Color} in the {@link Model}'s color list
102      to the same {@link Color} but randonly shaded brighter and darker.
103
104      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
105      @param c      {@link Color} for all of this model's {@link Vertex} objects
106   */
107   public static void setColorShaded(final Model model, final Color c)
108   {
109      final Random generator = new Random();
110
111      if (model.colorList.isEmpty())
112      {
113         for (int i = 0; i < model.vertexList.size(); ++i)
114         {
115            final Color c2;
116            final int choice = generator.nextInt(7);
117            if (0 == choice)
118            {
119               c2 = c.darker();
120            }
121            else if (1 == choice)
122            {
123               c2 = c.darker().darker();
124            }
125            else if (2 == choice)
126            {
127               c2 = c.darker().darker().darker();
128            }
129            else if (3 == choice)
130            {
131               c2 = c.brighter();
132            }
133            else if (4 == choice)
134            {
135               c2 = c.brighter().brighter();
136            }
137            else if (5 == choice)
138            {
139               c2 = c.brighter().brighter().brighter();
140            }
141            else // 6 == choice
142            {
143               c2 = c;
144            }
145            model.colorList.add(c2);
146         }
147      }
148      else
149      {
150         for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
151         {
152            for (final int i : p.cIndexList)
153            {
154               final Color c2;
155               final int choice = generator.nextInt(7);
156               if (0 == choice)
157               {
158                  c2 = c.darker();
159               }
160               else if (1 == choice)
161               {
162                  c2 = c.darker().darker();
163               }
164               else if (2 == choice)
165               {
166                  c2 = c.darker().darker().darker();
167               }
168               else if (3 == choice)
169               {
170                  c2 = c.brighter();
171               }
172               else if (4 == choice)
173               {
174                  c2 = c.brighter().brighter();
175               }
176               else if (5 == choice)
177               {
178                  c2 = c.brighter().brighter().brighter();
179               }
180               else // 6 == choice
181               {
182                  c2 = c;
183               }
184               model.colorList.set(i, c2);
185            }
186         }
187      }
188      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
189      {
190         setColorShaded(m, c); // recursion
191      }
192   }
193
194
195   /**
196      Set each front face {@link Color} in the {@link Model}'s color list
197      to the same random {@link Color} but randonly shaded brighter and darker.
198
199      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
200   */
201   public static void setRandomColorShaded(final Model model)
202   {
203      setColorShaded(model, randomColor());
204   }
205
206
207   /**
208      Give each of this {@code Model}'s nested models
209      a different random front face {@link Color}.
210
211      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
212   */
213   public static void setRandomNestedModelColors(final Model model)
214   {
215      final Color c = randomColor();
216      if (model.colorList.isEmpty())
217      {
218         for (int i = 0; i < model.vertexList.size(); ++i)
219         {
220            model.colorList.add(c);
221         }
222      }
223      else
224      {
225         for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
226         {
227            for (final int i : p.cIndexList)
228            {
229               model.colorList.set(i, c);
230            }
231         }
232      }
233      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
234      {
235         setRandomNestedModelColors(m); // recursion
236      }
237   }
238
239
240   /**
241      Set each {@link Vertex} in the {@link Model}
242      to a different random {@link Color}.
243      <p>
244      This creates a "rainbow model" effect.
245      <p>
246      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure"
247      the model might possess. AND it deletes any back
248      face colors that the model might have.
249
250      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
251   */
252   public static void setRandomVertexColors(final Model model)
253   {
254      model.colorList.clear(); // remove all the current colors
255      for (int i = 0; i < model.vertexList.size(); ++i)
256      {
257         model.colorList.add( randomColor() );
258      }
259      for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
260      {
261         for (int i = 0; i < p.vIndexList.size(); ++i)
262         {
263            p.cIndexList.set(i, p.vIndexList.get(i));
264         }
265      }
266      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
267      {
268         setRandomVertexColors(m); // recursion
269      }
270   }
271
272
273   /**
274      Set each {@link Primitive} in the {@link Model}
275      to a different (uniform) random {@link Color}.
276      <p>
277      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure"
278      the model might possess. AND it deletes any back
279      face colors that the model might have.
280
281      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
282   */
283   public static void setRandomPrimitiveColors(final Model model)
284   {
285      model.colorList.clear(); // remove all the current colors
286      int cIndex = 0;
287      for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
288      {
289         model.colorList.add( randomColor() );
290         for (int i = 0; i < p.cIndexList.size(); ++i)
291         {
292            p.cIndexList.set(i, cIndex);
293         }
294         ++cIndex;
295      }
296      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
297      {
298         setRandomPrimitiveColors(m); // recursion
299      }
300   }
301
302
303   /**
304      Set each {@link Primitive} in the {@link Model} to a
305      different (uniform) shade of the given {@link Color}.
306      <p>
307      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure"
308      the model might possess. AND it deletes any back
309      face colors that the model might have.
310
311      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
312      @param c      {@link Color} for this model's {@link Primitive} objects
313   */
314   public static void setPrimitiveColorShaded(final Model model, final Color c)
315   {
316      final Random generator = new Random();
317
318      model.colorList.clear(); // remove all the current colors
319      int cIndex = 0;
320      for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
321      {
322         final Color c2;
323         final int choice = generator.nextInt(7);
324         if (0 == choice)
325         {
326            c2 = c.darker();
327         }
328         else if (1 == choice)
329         {
330            c2 = c.darker().darker();
331         }
332         else if (2 == choice)
333         {
334            c2 = c.darker().darker().darker();
335         }
336         else if (3 == choice)
337         {
338            c2 = c.brighter();
339         }
340         else if (4 == choice)
341         {
342            c2 = c.brighter().brighter();
343         }
344         else if (5 == choice)
345         {
346            c2 = c.brighter().brighter().brighter();
347         }
348         else // 6 == choice
349         {
350            c2 = c;
351         }
352         model.colorList.add( c2 );
353         for (int i = 0; i < p.cIndexList.size(); ++i)
354         {
355            p.cIndexList.set(i, cIndex);
356         }
357         ++cIndex;
358      }
359      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
360      {
361         setPrimitiveColorShaded(m, c); // recursion
362      }
363   }
364
365
366   /**
367      Set each {@link Primitive} in the {@link Model}
368      to a different random {@link Color} at each endpoint.
369      <p>
370      This creates a "rainbow primitive" effect.
371      <p>
372      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure"
373      the model might possess. AND it deletes any back
374      face colors that the model might have.
375
376      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
377   */
378   public static void setRainbowPrimitiveColors(final Model model)
379   {
380      model.colorList.clear(); // remove all the current colors
381      int cIndex = 0;
382      for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
383      {
384         for (int i = 0; i < p.cIndexList.size(); ++i)
385         {
386            model.colorList.add( randomColor() );
387            p.cIndexList.set(i, cIndex);
388            ++cIndex;
389         }
390      }
391      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
392      {
393         setRainbowPrimitiveColors(m); // recursion
394      }
395   }
396
397
398   /**
399      Set a uniform back face color of each {@link OrientablePrimitive}
400      in the {@link Model} to the given {@link Color}. The given
401      {@link Color} object {@code c} is added to the
402      {@link Model}'s color list.
403
404      @param model  {@link Model} whose back face color is being manipulated
405      @param c      back face {@link Color} for all of the {@link Model}'s {@link Face} primitives
406   */
407   public static void setBackFaceColor(final Model model, final Color c)
408   {
409      final int bfColorIndex = model.colorList.size();
410      model.colorList.add(c);
411      for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
412      {
413         if (p instanceof OrientablePrimitive)
414         {
415            ((OrientablePrimitive)p).setBackFaceColorIndex(bfColorIndex);
416         }
417      }
418      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
419      {
420         setBackFaceColor(m, c); // recursion
421      }
422   }
423
424
425   /**
426      Set a uniform back face color of each {@link OrientablePrimitive}
427      in the {@link Model} to the {@link Color} with the given
428      color index into the {@link Model}'s color list.
429
430      @param model   {@link Model} whose back face color is being manipulated
431      @param cIndex  back face {@link Color} index for all of the {@link Model}'s {@link Face} primitives
432   */
433   public static void setBackFaceColor(final Model model, final int cIndex)
434   {
435      for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
436      {
437         if (p instanceof OrientablePrimitive)
438         {
439            ((OrientablePrimitive)p).setBackFaceColorIndex(cIndex);
440         }
441      }
442      for (final Model m : model.nestedModels)
443      {
444         setBackFaceColor(m, cIndex); // recursion
445      }
446   }
447
448
449   /**
450      Set the back face colors of each {@link OrientablePrimitive}
451      in the {@link Model} to the given {@link Color}s. The given
452      {@link Color} objects are added to the {@link Model}'s
453      color list.
454
455      @param model  {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
456      @param c0     back face {@link Color} for all of the {@code Model}'s {@link Triangle} primitives
457      @param c1     back face {@link Color} for all of the {@code Model}'s {@link Triangle} primitives
458      @param c2     back face {@link Color} for all of the {@code Model}'s {@link Triangle} primitives
459   */
460   public static void setBackFaceColor(final Model model,
461                                       final Color c0, final Color c1, final Color c2)
462   {
463      int i = model.colorList.size();
464      model.colorList.add(c0);
465      model.colorList.add(c1);
466      model.colorList.add(c2);
467      for (Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
468      {
469         if (p instanceof OrientablePrimitive)
470         {
471            ((OrientablePrimitive)p).setBackFaceColorIndex(i, i+1, i+2);
472         }
473      }
474      for (Model m : model.nestedModels)
475      {
476         setBackFaceColor(m, c0, c1, c2); // recursion
477      }
478   }
479
480
481   /**
482      Set the back face colors of each {@link OrientablePrimitive}
483      in the {@link Model} to the {@link Color}s with the given
484      color indices into the {@link Model}'s color list.
485
486      @param model    {@link Model} whose color list is being manipulated
487      @param cIndex0  back face {@link Color} index for all of the {@link Model}'s {@link Face} primitives
488      @param cIndex1  back face {@link Color} index for all of the {@link Model}'s {@link Face} primitives
489      @param cIndex2  back face {@link Color} index for all of the {@link Model}'s {@link Face} primitives
490   */
491   public static void setBackFaceColor(final Model model,
492                                       final int cIndex0, final int cIndex1, final int cIndex2)
493   {
494      for (Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
495      {
496         if (p instanceof OrientablePrimitive)
497         {
498            ((OrientablePrimitive)p).setBackFaceColorIndex(cIndex0,
499                                                           cIndex1,
500                                                           cIndex2);
501         }
502      }
503      for (Model m : model.nestedModels)
504      {
505         setBackFaceColor(m, cIndex0, cIndex1, cIndex2); // recursion
506      }
507   }
508
509
510   /**
511      Create a {@link Color} object with randomly generated {@code r},
512      {@code g}, and {@code b} values.
513
514      @return a reference to a randomly generated {@link Color} object
515   */
516   public static Color randomColor()
517   {
518      final Random generator = new Random();
519      final float r = generator.nextFloat();
520      final float g = generator.nextFloat();
521      final float b = generator.nextFloat();
522      return new Color(r, g, b);
523   }
524
525
526
527   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
528   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
529   private ModelShading() {
530      throw new AssertionError();
531   }
532}
